ygData.subject: Re: Why boys play girls
ygData.msgSnippet: Is a woman using emotional deceit if she flirts with a 20 year old boy, when she is 50, and doesn t tell him her age, allowing him to assume she is around his
ygData.messageBody:
Is a woman using emotional deceit if she flirts with a 20 year old boy,
when she is 50, and doesn't tell him her age, allowing him to assume she
is around his age?

Is a woman using emotional deceit if she flirts with a boy, and doesn't
tell him her racial background, allowing him to assume she is white when
she is not?

Is a woman using emotional deceit if she flirts with a boy, and doesn't
send him a picture, so he'll know whether or not he'd be attracted to her
in real life?

Is a woman using emotional deceit, if she flirts with a boy, and allows
him to assume she's not married, when she is?

What exactly must we disclose when we flirt with someone online before
we're being emotionally deceitful? Why do people get so worked up over
disclosing gender, in comparison with other qualities that define us?

- Tina

On Thu, 24 Feb 2000, Crystal wrote:
> My original rant wasn't so much about the fact that men play women, but
> rather when those phony women begin using emotional deceit with the players
> that they are with, building emotional friendships and relationships (or
> sexually suggestive relationships) without the honesty of who they really
> are. Does that make more sense? It probably plays into the gender issues
> cited at this site.
>
> Great site btw...refreshing to find. Thanks!
>
> Voxana
> Mage, Mith Marr
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Christina Norman <tina@...>
> To: <EQ_women@onelist.com>
> Sent: Thursday, February 24, 2000 1:27 PM
> Subject: [EQ_women] Why boys play girls
